original: LINDBERG, Eric Hemfrid, v Konsul, Hudiksvall, f Länghem, Vgl, 2/5 68 av lantbr, handl J E Nilsson o Hilda L. Volont.sk. fig träv.exp.fma sed. 92, fd skeppsred. Stdflm 312 LINDBERG sed. 03, ordf dräts.kamm sed. 06, hamnstyr, hdls- o sjöf.nmdn sed. 21, sjömansh.dir sed. 21, rev riksbkn i Gävle 12—18, portug v.kons 04, fr kons.ag 19. Ordf Hdsv köpm.frn sed. 09, v. styr.ordf Sv hdlsbkns avd.kont 16—40, styr.led Iggesunds—Hdsv stuv.bol. Resor: Samtl europ länd samt Afr o Asien årl. RVO, RPKO, OffFrdeFIp. Hobbies: Sport, utl.resor.
translated: LINDBERG, Eric Hemfrid, born in Länghem, Västergötland, on February 5th, 1868. Son of farmer and merchant J E Nilsson and Hilda L. Voluntary apprentice in the timber export business since 1892. Former shipowner. Member of the Hudiksvalls stadfilm 312 LINDBERG since 1903. Chairman of the finance committee since 1906. Member of the harbor board, trade, and maritime committee since 1921. Director of the Seamen's Home since 1921. Member of the board of the National Bank in Gävle from 1912 to 1918. Portuguese vice-consul since 1904. French consular agent since 1919. Chairman of the Hudiksvalls Köpmannaförening (Merchant Association) since 1909. Deputy chairman of the Swedish Handelsbankens avdelningskontor (branch office) from 1916 to 1940. Board member of Iggesunds—Hudiksvalls Stuveri AB. Travels: Regular trips to all European countries as well as Africa and Asia. Awards: Royal Order of Vasa, Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Officer of the French Legion of Honor. Hobbies: Sports, foreign travel.
